definition: belonging to or part of the real nature of something/somebody
a type of small orange without seeds and with loose skin that comes off easily
having no seeds
the placing of clauses and phrases one after the other, without words to link them or show their relationship
the use of subordinate clauses
a building with a pool where people can go to see dolphins, especially ones who have been trained to do tricks
covered with feathers or having feathers
not easily upset or worried by a difficult situation; calm
that cannot be changed or destroyed
in a calm way, without getting too upset or worried by a difficult situation
the ability to not get upset or worried by a difficult situation
a person who is receiving a pension, especially from the government
connected with the scientific study of the spread and control of diseases
the study of bells and the art of ringing bells
a large board with a smooth white surface that teachers, etc. write on with special pens
a piece of classroom equipment using a computer connected to a large screen that you can write on or use to control the computer by touching it with your finger or a pen
a reduction in the number of people living in a place
causing a lot of worry
suffering from serious damage to the brain and needing machines to stay alive
very stupid and boring; not intelligent
a large machine that is used for digging up the ground
a person or an animal that digs
a man
a large vehicle with equipment for digging, used in building roads, etc.
